title: Augusta County: John Scott to E. P. Smith, December 14, 1868
summary: Scott complains about a white assistant in his school, lamenting that she "is not more competent than several colored teachers. She dares not ask questions in grammar, and is obliged to review her Intermediate geography." He concludes, "I am therefore teaching a school so large that I must do either injustice to the children, or send some away, or soon break down myself--with this apprentice as my only help."
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Women, American Civil War
